availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hazel G. Petree, Jr. (Elkton, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, attorney. Todd County, Kentucky, native. Son of Hazel G. Petree, Sr., and Sallie Petree. Married to Mary M. Bristow Petree in Todd County, Kentucky, on May 16, 1854. Father of Emma E. Petree, Frank. B. Petree, Mattie A. Petree, and Sarah "Sallie" Petree. Studied law with Francis Marion Bristow at Elkton. Partner in a law firm with Bristow until 1864. Attorney in Todd County in 1850. Attorney in Elkton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 457-58.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 1, p. 208A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 690.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, Elkton, p. 83.
“Hazel Garland Petrie,” Find A Grave, Memorial #47596161, accessed May 30, 2017, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47596161.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Todd County Marriages, 1820-1886, Film #000367186.
